title: Why am I forced to build redemption/locket on supports ?
body: I've been playing only support this season and got from plat 3 to diamond 2. I like the role, but every game I feel like I'm being forced into buying redemption and locket, they're just too strong compared to other items, and if you go for something else like ardent/athenes/zz/banner/mikaels and even zhonya sometimes, you're just hurting your team. Especially if the enemy team has redemption/locket, and they always do. Games don't even last long enough to get any other item after those 2, so I'm just stuck every game with the same items over and over again. Idk what would be the solution, adding new items, or buffing old ones, but I know that right now, the itemization is stale and pretty boring.

Try to play a little of sona if you want a support able to magnify his kit without redemption and locket.

Something like Athene + Censor + boots + Eye is a good start to go the path of healing, and could be your build for most games if you like it. 

It doesn't look much, but athene works as a healing sheen / lichbane on her - it can double your healing output and do it consistently. And her heal / shield scales better with AP than + % heal / shield, so censor is a great add-on.

From then you can pick whatever you need. I'll suggest lichbane if your team needs help to burst something asap (vayne is my go-to example), rylai if you need to peel against a juggernaut (you can almost permaslow with that by lategame), IBG if you feel the armor / slow could help you, or more traditionnal support items if you choose to. Or grab a NLR if you feel like it, since you scale really hard with AP.

You won't heal as much as soraka of course, and you'll never burst heal as well as soraka, but you become more of a team support - and an awesome one. Try to time your heals so you also shield the incoming damage - it goes a long way to win fights.

Hope this helped ^^

Yeah, Soraka is really strong right now, especially with all the healing amp gear available, but the glaring weakness I keep running into when she's on my team is that she lacks quality, reliable CC. Her poke is even subpar, unless you're really good with her.

Nobody in the game can touch her healing output though... 200 + 60% AP on a 1.2s cd (at 40% and rank 5) + healing amp + ult + Redemption. Since Exhaust got wrecked, I've been running Heal on my supports too, and it works great, so she can even add that too.

The problem is that nobody wants to play tanks or CC mages. It's all squishy assassins and mobility carries, so when they get caught (all the time), they die--often times even through an emergency Soraka ult. However, when I'm the tank (or at least bruiser) and my duo partner is playing Soraka behind me, we tend to carry teamfights. Would still like it if her CC was a touch better since she has almost no damage.

Early in the season I tried to move to support secondary (once it was clear I'll still be getting my primary role more often than not), but this is one of the reasons I decided not to. With these 2 items, I feel like there are fewer viable build paths for most supports than there used to be, so itemization feels boring.

Because support (role) is just an item mule for the team. It doesn't get enough gold or experience to be awesome with everyone else, and required stat efficiency means their items can never be strong without breaking the game.
It's been this way since the EU meta took hold (1-1-1-2) in S1.

It just *feels* worse right now because supports have more income than ever (excluding pre-S4), but are *still* item mules.

Ive been maining nami lately, and Im loving redemption. I usually get to full items, just because I only pick up support items
